transcript.text: Check your understanding of what’s acceptable and what’s not. Select acceptable or unacceptable for each option, then click on Submit.

contentText.text: Are these gifts Acceptable or Unacceptable?

instructionText.text: Select Acceptable or Unacceptable for each option then click on Submit.
Click on Next (bottom right arrow) to continue.

option.text: A Johnson Controls employee sends a pen with the Johnson Controls logo to a customer to mark the end of a successful project
During the holidays, a supplier sends a USD$50 gift certificate to a Johnson Controls employee
A vendor gives a Johnson Controls employee 4 box-seat tickets to a professional sports playoff game, telling the employee that he receives the tickets for free from his company

option.img: Employee holding a Bottle of Champagne
option.text: A long-time supplier, who is currently bidding on a Johnson Controls contract, sends a few bottles of champagne to the Johnson Controls team

correct.text:
• The Johnson Controls threshold for reporting gifts is USD$200.
  • You may accept gifts valued at less than USD$200 provided there is no intent to improperly influence you or create a future obligation.
  • If you are offered a gift worth USD$200 or above (such as the game tickets), you must disclose this using a gift form. The form will be reviewed and you will be advised whether you can keep the gift or not.
  • You may not offer or accept any value of cash or cash equivalents, such as gift cards.
  • All gifts intended to be offered to commercial customers must be approved in advance by your business manager.
  • Gifts intended to be offered to Government officials require pre-approval, 7 days in advance, using the AB form.
  • Forms can be found at http://complianceforms.jci.com
